tool.name: bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
tool.command:
bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
## Default section ${sec_default.all_sites} --genotypes "${sec_default.genotypes}" --GTs-only "${sec_default.GTs_only}" ${sec_default.homs_only} --plot "${sec_default.plot}" #set values_sec_default_regions = '","'.join([str($value) for $value in $sec_default.regions_repeat]) --regions "${values_sec_default_regions}" --regions-file "${sec_default.regions_file}" --query-sample "${sec_default.query_sample}" --target-sample "${sec_default.target_sample}" #set values_sec_default_targets = '","'.join([str($value) for $value in $sec_default.targets_repeat]) --targets "${values_sec_default_targets}" --targets-file "${sec_default.targets_file}"

param.help: use GTs, ignore PLs, using <int> for unseen genotypes
param.label: Gts Only
param.name: GTs_only

param.help: homozygous genotypes only (useful for low coverage data)
param.label: Homs Only
param.name: homs_only

param.help: restrict to comma-separated list of regions
param.label: Regions
param.name: regions

param.help: restrict to regions listed in a file
param.label: Regions File
param.name: regions_file

param.help: query sample (by default the first sample is checked)
param.label: Query Sample
param.name: query_sample

param.help: target sample in the -g file (used only for plotting)
param.label: Target Sample
param.name: target_sample

param.help: similar to -r but streams rather than index-jumps
param.label: Targets
param.name: targets

param.help: similar to -R but streams rather than index-jumps
param.label: Targets File
param.name: targets_file

tool.help: Check sample identity. With no -g BCF given, multi-sample cross-check is performed.
